content.question: Venus warns Aeneas. ‘Ipse pater DanaisDanaus, -i, m.: Greek animos viresquevis, vis, f.: strength, force, power secundas sufficit,sufficio, -ere: supply, provide ipse deos in DardanaDardanus, -a, -um: Trojan suscitat arma. Eripe,eripio, -ere: snatch away, take nate, fugam finemque impone labori; nusquam abero et tutum patrio te liminelimen, liminis, n.: threshold sistam.’sisto, -ere: place, put, stand Aeneid 2.617-620 Translate the passage above as literally as possible.

frqParts.text: Venus warns Aeneas. ‘Ipse pater DanaisDanaus, -i, m.: Greek animos viresquevis, vis, f.: strength, force, power secundas sufficit,sufficio, -ere: supply, provide ipse deos in DardanaDardanus, -a, -um: Trojan suscitat arma. Eripe,eripio, -ere: snatch away, take nate, fugam finemque impone labori; nusquam abero et tutum patrio te liminelimen, liminis, n.: threshold sistam.’sisto, -ere: place, put, stand Aeneid 2.617-620 Translate the passage above as literally as possible.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
